name: starch

starch noun [U]
(FOOD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a white substance that exists in large amounts in potatoes and particular grains such as rice: Corn starch is used as a thickener in stews. Compare
carbohydrate

starch noun [U]
(CLOTH)
a white substance from potatoes and particular grains, used to make cloth stiff

You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics:
Cleaning clothes
to make clothes stiff by washing them with starch: She wore a starched white apron over her black dress.

starch noun
(FOOD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C/U ]
  biology a substance that exists in large amounts in many plants
[ C/U ] Starches are foods containing a large amount of starch, such as potatoes, rice, bread, pasta, and cereal.
starch noun
(CHEMICAL)
[ U ] a chemical that is used to make cloth stiff
starch verb [T]
(ADD CHEMICAL)
to add starch to cloth to make it stiff: I starch all my dress shirts.
